messages.text:
I don't understand what's going on in my Documenter build, almost every example block errors with `MethodError: no method matching iterate(::Nothing)`<https://gitlab.com/JuliaGPU/AbstractPlotting-jl/-/jobs/912130931>

The return objects in these blocks are all new kinds of figure objects that I'm introducing in that PR, and granted a lot of them should error, but at least a couple shouldn't. I have only overloaded the `display` method for them, but I don't even understand where iteration is going on? I tested a very simple block and that worked fine for me locally..

Is Documenter doing something with my return values that they don't allow?

attachments.title: docs (#912130931) · Jobs · JuliaGPU / AbstractPlotting-jl
attachments.text: An abstract interface for plotting libraries, part of the Makie ecosystem.

messages.text: Hello.  I've suggested a pull request to Base.Docs to improve `HTML` so that it can nest property.  I don't see any detrimental side-effect of this change (the existing behavior is pretty much unusable so I can't imagine anyone relying upon it).  <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/38889>

messages.text:
Hey everyone ! I'm quite new to versionning and releases on Github and I'm having some issues when using a Github Actions deployment of my docs.

When I created the first release on github, my Github Actions bot does the job and everything works fine. The gh-page branch is created, with a stable and a v1.0. When added some commit to master, it generates the dev page perfectly.

But when I try to add a second release called v1.1, I'm getting the following error :
From <https://github.com/jrmbr/MyPackage.jl>
 * [new branch]      gh-pages   -> upstream/gh-pages
 * [new branch]      master     -> upstream/master
 * [new tag]         v1.1       -> v1.1
 * [new tag]         v1.0       -> v1.0
Switched to a new branch 'gh-pages'

Branch 'gh-pages' set up to track remote branch 'gh-pages' from 'upstream'.
┌ Error: Failed to push:
│   exception =
│    ArgumentError: link `"v1" => "v1.1"` incompatible with link `"v1.0" => "v1"`.

elements.text:
Hey everyone ! I'm quite new to versionning and releases on Github and I'm having some issues when using a Github Actions deployment of my docs.

When I created the first release on github, my Github Actions bot does the job and everything works fine. The gh-page branch is created, with a stable and a v1.0. When added some commit to master, it generates the dev page perfectly.

But when I try to add a second release called v1.1, I'm getting the following error :
From
https://github.com/jrmbr/MyPackage.jl

* [new branch]      gh-pages   -> upstream/gh-pages
 * [new branch]      master     -> upstream/master
 * [new tag]         v1.1       -> v1.1
 * [new tag]         v1.0       -> v1.0
Switched to a new branch 'gh-pages'

Branch 'gh-pages' set up to track remote branch 'gh-pages' from 'upstream'.
┌ Error: Failed to push:
│   exception =
│    ArgumentError: link `"v1" => "v1.1"` incompatible with link `"v1.0" => "v1"`.

messages.text:
Hi, I'm fighting a bit with `"`  in docstrings.
I want to have something like
`j1 = JSON.parse("""{"a": 4, "b": {"a":1, "b": 1}}""")` in the `jldoctest` , but it's telling me `ERROR: syntax: cannot juxtapose string literal` .
I though I'll use only `"`  and escape them inside string, but having
`julia> j1 = JSON.parse("{\"a\": 4, \"b\": {\"a\":1, \"b\": 1}}");`  in `jldoctest` also crashes with `ERROR: syntax: cannot juxtapose string literal` .
What other options are there?
EDIT: solved, I need to escape 2 times:
`julia> j1 = JSON.parse("{\\"a\\": 4, \\"b\\": {\\"a\\":1, \\"b\\": 1}}");`  this works

messages.text:
I can't remember (or perhaps I never knew) how to escape triple-quoted strings in docstrings:
```"""
    readabigstring(str)

Read a big string.

Example:

```
bigstring = """
    this is a big string
"""
readabigstring(bigstring)
```
"""```
I don't think `@ raw` is the one.

elements.text: I can't remember (or perhaps I never knew) how to escape triple-quoted strings in docstrings:

"""
    readabigstring(str)

Read a big string.

```

"""

I don't think
@ raw
is the one.

I don't know how difficult implementation would be for Documenter.jl, but it would a cool/useful feature for it.

messages.text:
Hey there. I used to build my documentation for InformationGeometry.jl via Travis and had everything running perfectly until I ran out of Travis credits recently and am now trying to switch to building with github actions.

I've added the necessary .yml file, the "Build and deploy" action is triggered as intended, the build itself is successful, but the deployment fails:
```┌ Error: Git failed to fetch git@github.com:RafaelArutjunjan/InformationGeometry.jl.git
│ This can be caused by a DOCUMENTER_KEY variable that is not correctly set up.
│ Make sure that the environment variable is properly set up as a Base64-encoded string
│ of the SSH private key. You may need to re-generate the keys with DocumenterTools.
└ @ Documenter ~/.julia/packages/Documenter/FuXcO/src/Documenter.jl:554```
Now I'm no expert on the inner workings of Documenter.jl or the github actions system, but the documentation of Documenter.jl makes it sound like the DOCUMENTER_KEY is only really necessary for use with Travis CI? Do I even need it if I use github actions to build and deploy docs?

So do I generate a new key? Do I just delete the old one I have set up or does that then break something else, like the TagBot? Do I have to adjust any .yml files?

I would be grateful for any guidance on this.

elements.text:
Hey there. I used to build my documentation for InformationGeometry.jl via Travis and had everything running perfectly until I ran out of Travis credits recently and am now trying to switch to building with github actions.

I've added the necessary .yml file, the "Build and deploy" action is triggered as intended, the build itself is successful, but the deployment fails:

┌ Error: Git failed to fetch git@github.com:RafaelArutjunjan/InformationGeometry.jl.git
│ This can be caused by a DOCUMENTER_KEY variable that is not correctly set up.
│ Make sure that the environment variable is properly set up as a Base64-encoded string
│ of the SSH private key. You may need to re-generate the keys with DocumenterTools.
└ @ Documenter ~/.julia/packages/Documenter/FuXcO/src/Documenter.jl:554

Now I'm no expert on the inner workings of Documenter.jl or the github actions system, but the documentation of Documenter.jl makes it sound like the DOCUMENTER_KEY is only really necessary for use with Travis CI? Do I even need it if I use github actions to build and deploy docs?

So do I generate a new key? Do I just delete the old one I have set up or does that then break something else, like the TagBot? Do I have to adjust any .yml files?

I would be grateful for any guidance on this.

messages.text: <@UDB26738Q> and are facing a very strange problem deploying docs with github actions. We are getting seeing the "failed to push" error (e.g. <https://github.com/giordano/AnalyzeRegistry.jl/runs/1923535431#step:5:38>) when using the `DOCUMENTER_KEY` but not when using the `GITHUB_TOKEN`. He's regenerated the key with DocumenterTools several times without success. I wonder if there is a more general problem here, since there are several messages in this channel about what seems like the same problem.

? It should try to print out the SSH key fingerprint in the log.
